returns.active: bool indicating if claim is active

setMerkleClaimActive().details: This function can only be called by an address with the manager role

setMerkleClaimInactive().details: This function can only be called by an address with the manager role

updateMerkleRoot(bytes32).details: This function can only be called by an address with the manager role

params.newMerkleRoot: The new Merkle root hash value to be set

isMerkleClaimActive().notice: Returns true if elegible tokens can be claimed, or false otherwise

merkleRoot().notice: Returns the current Merkle root hash

setMerkleClaimActive().notice: Updates the claim state to active and enables the claim of tokens

setMerkleClaimInactive().notice: Updates the claim state to inactive and disables the claim of tokens

updateMerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: Updates the Merkle root hash with a new value

userdoc.notice: This contract provides external functions to retrieve and update the Merkle root hash, which is used to verify the authenticity of data in a Merkle tree. This contract can be used as a facet of a diamond which follows the EIP-2535 diamond standard.
